headline: Banks report 'healthy' earnings: Analyst breaks it down
summary: Charles Schwab (SCHW) reported record revenue in the third quarter, while Bank of New York Mellon (BK) and US Bancorp (USB) beat estimates on the top and bottom lines. S&P Global Market Intelligence director of financial institutions research, Nathan Stovall, joins Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman to discuss bank earnings. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts. Editor's note: The headline and thumbnail of this post have been updated to more accurately reflect the companies covered.

headline: Is BNY Mellon’s 44% Rally in 2024 Justified After Strong Q1 Results?
summary: If you’ve been eyeing Bank of New York Mellon stock, you’re definitely not alone. With markets constantly in motion and investor sentiment shifting, making the right call on this global financial heavyweight can feel like navigating a maze. But if you’ve watched the recent numbers climb, it’s no wonder you’re curious. headline: AI's boom continues as TSMC reveals a big jump in profits
summary: The world's biggest producer of advanced chips, raised its full-year revenue forecast on a bullish outlook for spending on artificial intelligence. TSMC (TSM) posted record profits that blew past market estimates. The world's largest food company, Nestle (NESN.SW) saw it shares soar after it announced 16,000 global job cuts. Bank of New York Mellon (BK) and KeyCorp (KEY) also revealed Q3 earnings before the opening bell.

headline: BNY’s (NYSE:BK) Q3: Beats On Revenue
summary: Global financial services company BNY NYSE:BK) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, with sales up 9.3% year on year to $5.08 billion. Its GAAP profit of $1.88 per share was 6.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Stocks Climb Before the Open on AI Optimism, Earnings and Fed Speak in Focus
summary: December S&P 500 E-Mini futures (ESZ25) are up +0.43%, and December Nasdaq 100 E-Mini futures (NQZ25) are up +0.48% this morning as signs of continued strong demand for artificial intelligence helped shift investors’ attention from escalating U.S.-China trade tensions.
